characters: SOUND OF SINGLE STREAM OF URINE TRICKLING INTO WATER
THEY WERE EFFIGIES OF FOREST DEMONS AND WILD ANIMALS.
MONSTER COSTUMES OF A VARIETY OF WEST AFRICAN TRIBES, AS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angle on: the plastic exterior of a screen-less televisio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through it we see children running in circles on a footba pitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angle on the boy balancing it on his head, AGU (10), a wa smile and clever eyes. Next to him, DIKE, his littler bes friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which ones having talent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That one...not that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu passes a line of YOUNG MEN lying on wheel barrows whi carrying the TV. Dike and their YOUNG RECRUITS, the kids were scouting on the football pitch, follow suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu and Dike drop the TV down on a stool in front of the VILLAGE CONSTABLE, charming it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu, what am I supposed to be doing with this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching TV, Massah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is not having a screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is imagination TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu has the YOUNG RECRUITS perform, framed in the empty s of the demolished television. The Constable is unimpresse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is garbage. Go, get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu disappointed but not discouraged, looks at the PEACE OBSERVERS with optimism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu stands in front of white helmeted NIGERIAN troops. Th 2ND LIEUTENANT humors him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't have any channels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu turns the knob swiftly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is having 12, and one more, that is the imagination channel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He addresses his YOUNG RECRUITS to PERFORM again. The 2nd Lieutenant is amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how much for this treasure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3000. And you are giving us some of your foods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2nd Lieutenant motions to his CORPORAL to get something o of the carrier. The corporal comes back with several PLAS CONTAINERS OF RICE AND SAUCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu reviews the food. 2nd Lieutenant pulls out a pack of from his side pocket to sweeten the deal. Agu snatches up takings, giving some cash to Dike and his recruits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu walks home with Dike, arguing playfully, when a cheap puttering Chinese motorcycle pulls up with BIG BROTHER (1 and a FRIEND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you two girls plotting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come, I have job for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu hangs from a tree. Dike hangs from another branch as each take turns sawing a larger branch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Brother directs them from below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Brother. He is always having ideas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They cut the large tree limb and let it crash across the street just as a BUSH TAXI comes. They charge it a "tax".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Agu counts the change, an OLD WITCH WOMAN arrives from bush. From everyone's reaction to her we can see she is t crazy of the village. All the BOYS watch her warily. The WOMAN focuses in on Agu in particular.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enh!   You are not greeting me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old woman holds out a handful of groundnuts, dirty an greasy in her palms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Witch woman. Nobody is talking to her because every person is fearing her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Old Woman talks while rearranging her ground nuts in palm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These young person not behaving well anymore, just acting like animal. But it is okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trouble go follow you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No trouble go follow me. I am a good boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Bush Taxi zooms PAST, barely missing the old woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trouble go touch you old woman if you stay standing in the middle of the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am knowing you, boy. I am knowing your family. And trouble go follow all of you. Thieves! Throw an old woman like me from her land! Devil go bless your family!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another bush taxi zooms by as she goes on her way RANTING herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a good family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu's FATHER (30's) teaches a primary school class about African fauna. Agu can barely stay awake as he looks out window. Father snaps his fingers in his face, asking "Whe do the lions live, Agu?" Agu responds, "In the zoo."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Father was   a teacher. But since war is making   it so we have no more school, he is   keeping busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FATHER, who is Agu's father, directs the building of a makeshift INTERNALLY DISPLACED PERSON (IDP) camp along wi the PARAMOUNT CHIEF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and the Paramount Chief cut some of our land so that all of the refugees can be having a place to be staying. Mother is saying he is always doing good things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu lays on his MOTHER's (30's) back as he reads out loud from a nature magazine. Father observes them while smokin his pipe. Agu looks up at his father happily, comfortable safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother. Before she was having children she was also being a teacher, but she is saying raising childrens is too too much work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu sits behind his MOTHER preparing dinner while humming SONG. She QUIZZES Agu on the ingredients of the meal she making.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He enjoys watching her work, his BABY BROTHER swaddled on back as she SINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LITTLE SISTER sits next to him, mimicking him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother is always working hard for us and so I am thanking her by working hard too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the road home, Agu, comfortably sitting between his Bi Brother and a friend, notices 16 REFUGEES walking TOWARDS village, their meager items placed on their head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Agu, they are impossibly fascinating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Brother takes a bath in an outdoor shower surrounded thatch. He is covered in suds when he feels Agu peeing a spray on him. He clears his face in the pee and immediate tears after Agu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Brother, he is more concerned with his muscles, and his skin. Sometimes I add to his products.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Brother has captured Agu and is rolling him up in a t carpet that makes it impossible for him to use his arms t escape. He looks like a tampon with a head as Big Brother props him up against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Brother is also concerned with sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Brother is talking about sleeping with a girl in the village as he dances to music from a tape deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not liking his music, and I am not like his dancing, and if he is playing it loud loud I do not know how this girl will be sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuming, Agu looks like he is about to cry as he yells at brother to be let go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu sits uncomfortably on one of the church benches among hundreds of people listening to a PASTOR with his SUPPORT STAFF with MUSICIANS behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am going to church every Sunday with my family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up, distracted, at the spinning CEILING FANS. Mo pinches his leg, motioning for him to pay attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Brother is making eyes with a TEENAGE GIRL from acros the aisle. She returns his affection coyly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu looks at Father who pretends like he is dozing to entertain Agu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father is saying that Pastor is thinking he can be talking so much because he is having his Reverend Doctorate -- that is making him doctor of "talking."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On another pew, Dike sits with a well dressed family. The raise their chins in salutation as everyone stands to sin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PARISHIONERS spill out of the church clapping and sin in a parade of music and dance. The church brass and percussion band BLASTING A CELEBRATORY TUNE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God is liking    music more than just talking so if    we are singing and dancing, then    He is listening to us well well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FATHER snatches the Tape Player from the shelf, hitting t machine to make it stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is wrong with you? You know you cannot waste batteries on such nonsense!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu and Big Brother can't help laughing as Father slaps t laugh out of Big Brother from the back of his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you? What are you doing? (to Big Brother) Unroll him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Brother snaps the carpet, spinning Agu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu. What are these?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father holds up several the plastic containers of food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I?   I. I. I. what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got them from the Nigerians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do not need handouts. We are not beggars on the street. We are not refugees. I work for this family and I provide for this family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I earned-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will return them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father looks at Agu a beat longer to ensure Agu understan then he tenders a forced smile to release the tension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good dancing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, help Mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu's Sister sweeps the grounds between the kitchen hut a the main house with a small wad of reeds fashioned into a broom. Agu grates a long reedy root into a bowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the house, Agu spies FATHER resting on a chair whi listening to the RADIO, a BBC-like AFRICAN CORRESPONDENT reporting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would seem things are changing quickly within the interim government. As of this morning, the NRC junta moved to abolish all political parties, further consolidating their control of the government in the wake of the recent military coup...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu's GRANDFATHER sits on a bench. His eyes are open, sta into the courtyard, but he does not appear to be awake, f buzzing around his milky eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu walks in front of him, bending closer to look at him, makes funny poses, does "the robot." Grandfather does not react.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant General Sangania, commander-in-chief of the armed forces responsible for the junta, stated in a recent press conference that it was his intention to rid the southern regions of the PLF...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu leans in closer to his Grandfather, seeing that his father is not paying attention, he uses the long reed and tickles Grandfather's nostrils. His nose twitches but he not stop Agu. Agu laughs to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He also condemned the Native Defence Force militias, who he said presented a threat to the very fabric of national security...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeing Agu, FATHER turns off the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu, realizing he is caught, turns towards Father but hol the straw behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Expecting to be yelled at, Agu's father says...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay Agu, do not be worrying. We are in a safe place, we are in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "-Buffer zone". That is why so many refugee are coming here small small. Many people are suffering but we are not, here we are safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu walks back to the kitchen. In the background, we hear BBC Correspondent back ON again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu and Big Brother fill up water for the evening's cooki and dishes. Big Brother's arms work hard to pump the wate He looks at Agu, contemplating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was your age, if I was doing the same things you are doing, Father would beat me. You are lucky this war is happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not lucky. It is just because everyone is liking me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then some MEN passing by yell out, "Hello Agu!" Big Brother is ignored. Agu notices the teenage girl Big Brot likes passing by, so does he, pumping harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she disappears down the bend, he motions to his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When she is seeing these, her knees must be wobbling with hunger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu snorts with laughter now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if the dialogue continues, Agu and Big Brother carry w on their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you will see, I will be like this with all the girls in town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses the air on each side of him several times, as i were surrounded by women that wanted a peck on the lips f him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu, his Big Brother, his Father, his Mother, and his bab sister sit on the floor of the house around a large dinne plate of rice with cassava.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu feeds his Grandfather, who chews slowly, but again se unaffected by his surroundings. When he can, Agu stuffs h face with food to catch up to everyone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are seeing that witch woman on the road today. She is saying we are thieves. Why is she saying that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is not right in her head. God has taken away her ration. The land we are letting the refugees use has been in our family since before your Grandfather, we gave her a place in the camp but she refused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu watches his father eat, slowly, tasting and appreciat every bite, smiling at Mother. Agu realizes his own way o eating is much more voracious and hasty. He mimics his fa the next bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So she's crazy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu burps involuntarily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father looks up from his meal. Mother sighs as Big Brothe joins with a burp, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu laughs, as Father joins in with his own long and bellowing BURRRRRP. Agu is in tears laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They quiet down again, but suddenly Sister FARTS. They al are hysterical on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eventually the laughter subsides and Father notices somet beyond Agu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enh?   What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu looks over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father gets up and walks across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Brother notices, too, and his eyes lead us to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSERT: on a TV WITHOUT its case. The tube and the knobs dangling by its side. It is the TV that Agu sold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father lunges after Agu. FREEZE FRAME again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu sleeps on the front porch, afraid to go inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am a good boy. But sometimes I am sleeping outside so I am not having to go inside and be getting a beating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights go out on the porch. Agu looks out over the to as all lights go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother lights candles and lamps and steps out over him to what is going on in town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father walks over with his radio, shaking it for a better signal. She looks to him for an answer as a RADIO BROADCA plays the voice of the LIEUTENANT GENERAL addressing the and requesting they lay down their weapons in return for amnesty within 24 hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why so fearful? Doesn't the light go out all the time? It will come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother holds onto Father. Agu watches them from the doorw She turns towards him, adjusting her display of fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on Agu, go to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No beating?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father brings Mother in close, Agu waits for an answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up! Get up, now!    We are going to church!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father shakes Agu awake. Agu, still groggy, hides his fac from the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it is not Sunday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu sees his Father's stress. So does Big Brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu and his family watch as a long convoy of NRC Junta Ar trucks enter their town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is saying in the Bible that God is only helping those who are helping themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu and family are pressed against the wall, everyone dri with sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu, between the towering adults, looks up at the fans bu they are not turning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't God protecting the Israelites when they are having to leave their own home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Brother sees Agu struggling below and picks him up an puts him on his shoulders so he can see. Agu whispers to brother...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is Dike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu scans the room for Dike and his family, but cannot se them. The Pastor speaks from a podium while an ECOMOD CAPTAIN, LOCAL IMAM, PARAMOUNT CHIEF holding his golden talisman, a LINGUIST, ASSISTANT PASTOR, VILLAGE ELDERS, O FEMALE REPRESENTATIVE sit behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu smiles to himself, the Pastor looks desperate to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We cannot allow ourselves to face voluntary self-destruction. May God bless us all!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverend Doctorate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu looks down at his Father to share his observation, bu his father has a look that Agu has never seen before: fea The entire room is gripped with it as they murmur their concerns and beliefs to their neighbors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about our homes, property we leave behind? Our crops? Who will protect them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd goes silent as the PARAMOUNT CHIEF leans forwar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linguist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Linguist joins him at his side, leaning over to liste The crowd leans in, knowing that the Linguist will only filter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am listening to the Pastor and to the Imam, and the representative for the women, and what they have to say is wise, but not all of it. It is right that we must be helping ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NRC Junta telling us to be running away is not acceptable. Our forefathers have lived on this land for centuries. It is our duty to preserve it for our children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd adjusts and shifts nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that the NRC has broken its promise and entered the buffer zone, we should be accepting ECOMOD help and be sending women and the small small children to safer areas. But we who call ourselves men must stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of the crowd reacts in favor of the Chief while many more MOAN in fear, drowning out the Linguist's call...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting over the crowd) The Section Chiefs and their deputies should be assembling after this to discuss protection of this village. We all must do our part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FAMILIES ERUPT in protest. The crowd DIVIDES and breaks i arguments again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can the world be doing      We must all be leaving, t nothing if we have rebels so    is the only way. so close?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebels over here, Army over     What about the refugees? there, it is so so bad. We      people must be helped fir will be squashed in the middle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The refugees are our problem, they are our guests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Insults are slung from across one side of the room to another, but the Chief is done and parts the crowd on his out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father, I am not seeing Dike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother looks at Father. Pleadingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is my responsibility...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father, where is Dike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dike and his family are gone!     They fled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu and Big Brother watch Father push his way through the crowd towards the Paramount Chief and Elders, disappearin with other Section Chiefs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu and Big Brother listen through a wall as his mother a father argue. They play with flashlights over a game of draughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cannot be moved, he is an old man. And I won't force-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I am thinking that you are having no sense at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is so irrational about staying with your sister in the Capital, I will be coming to meet you once I am knowing everything is safe here. I cannot just be abandoning my responsibilities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then you are abandoning us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father throws his arms up in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just remove that thought from you head. What are we just supposed to be doing, then? Enh? Just running into the bush and living like rats?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you are not understanding anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want me to be a refugee in my own country, with three children in my arms and no husband? We are one family, we must be staying as one family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not asking you. I am telling you woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father knows he deeply wounded Mother, but he also knows will not argue further, even at the cost of their intimac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ECOMOD TROOPS stand next to a JEEP, TWO TROOP CARRIERS, A SEVERAL CIVILIAN LORIES in the market. A CONVOY of TRUCKS filled with stuff and people piled on top muscles out of town, leaving them in a black cloud of exhaust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The market is packed with men trying to pack their women children into bush taxis, trucks, dump trunks and flat be any vehicle that will help them evacuate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father pulls his family towards one of the last cars to b loaded. The DRIVER, a flat and sweaty face with froth in corners of his mouth, cuts him off-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come back tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the Section Chief and this is my family, there must be space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one woman and these small small children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver looks at Agu's mother, little brother strapped her back, and sister, and then down at Agu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the little boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not a "little" boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver, amused, reveals black teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Him, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Driver scratches his head doing basic spatial math: t are at least NINE people piled into the front and back se of the station wagon. The trunk is filled with luggage as well as a pile on the roof towering at least ten-feet hig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And where are you thinking this woman and child will be fitting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am thinking this women and children are more valuable than all this luggage you have piled in back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to the front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can be sitting with you in the front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver laughs off the suggestion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the boy-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -The driver raises his finger to shush him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will find another way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No bargaining. Or are you wanting your woman to be walking through the bush to the capital?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother looks prideful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would rather be walking then leaving my child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not leaving him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. How much to fit the boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO FAMILIES, seeing an opportunity, start OFFERING MONEY the driver to take the Mother's space. Without recourse, Father starts pushing her towards the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No we cannot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father is picking up Little Sister to place her inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I cannot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering, consoling) Do not scare them. You are strong. You will be okay. Take care of them and I will take care of our boys. Now get in, there is no choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father pays the Driver as Mother kneels down to Agu, unab to speak, on the verge of breaking down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember to be praying praying to God all the time and not to be worrying, we will be seeing each other soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hugs and kisses him, grabs his hands, before turning away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slides into the front seat, the gearshift situated between her legs, Sister and Little Brother on her lap. T more people between her and the passenger door. All are h uncomfortable, and scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cannot bear to be looking at Agu, Big Brother or Fath instead, she looks a the faces around her, and then forwa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father holds Agu by both shoulders in front of him. Agu begins to cry. He cannot see Mother. He tries to move but Father holds him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are with the men now, Agu. Be strong, wave goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Brother is holding back tears as well, struggling jus hard to be strong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The engine rumbles to a start spewing black smoke onto Ag and what's left of his family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the car pulls away, Agu cannot help himself, he breaks away and runs after the car, crying after his mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu's brother grabs his hand and holds him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father looks at them tenderly. The square, filled with th sounds of straining engines and crying families.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is how it is starting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last light of day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu, Big Brother, his Father and Grandfather sit around a meager plate of rice and sauce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They eat quietly. Agu doesn't like the taste of his fathe cooking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I am closing my eye, I am seeing the rainy season and how in my village, they are saying it is always bringing change too fast. You can be finding that the whole world is washing away beneath your feets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father feeds Grandfather, the activity helping keep his thoughts in order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, THUNDER rolls, or   something that sounds like i Father is acutely aware of   it, as if it could be artill Agu doesn't seem to notice   as the camera moves away fro family and out towards the   wet countryside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can be walking on road and finding that you are swimming in river. You can be starting day all dry and warm and then be finishing with your clothes like another skin on your body. Nothing is ever for sure and everything is always changing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUNDS OF BATTLE replace thunder. More coarse, pierci booms than thunder. Panting breath. Pattering feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu runs with his Father, Big Brother, and Grandfather do the middle of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just behind them a contingent of 20 PLF REBELS descend on foot. Bullets zip by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu and his family find a SMALL GROUP of civilians waitin the ground, pinned down by gunfire. Some of the MEN from Church with clubs and machetes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father nods to them, points in one direction. They shake their heads. He points in the other direction. They shake their heads no again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They ALL slip between the stairs of the same building, assessing their situation. Rebels spread out on the hill overlooking the town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no where to go. Father looks at his children, knowing it was a mistake not to get them out of town. Beckoned by a village man, the family runs across the roa Grandfather on Big Brother's back, into a building where other villagers are hiding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water leaks from the ceiling onto the group of TEN MEN an BOYS, their rudimentary weapons pointed towards the ceili squeezed looking and sometimes avoiding each other's gaze exposing their fear and expectation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not feeling my legs. It is like they are belonging to other

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, the SOUNDS of battle come from all directions. I an invisible looming threat heralded by a cacophony of hi pitched projectiles, ground shaking explosions, and CRIES the wounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG. Father looks out a small slit. He sees an NRC SOLDI FALL from a sniper hit. The soldiers move for cover, seemingly held at bay by the nearby shooter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks back at all the faces in the room with him. Fear Another shot rings out, it is near. He looks up and reali the SNIPER is in their building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his Father) Will they be killing us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN slaps his face, but he cannot see who it was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they are finding us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu turns towards his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They will drive our body into the bush, just leaving us for animal to be eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through his teeth) Shut up, I say. They will be finding us only if you keep talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if they are rebel they will be cutting off our hand and holding them to be shaking each other, is that what you are wanting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STRING of BULLETS hits the concrete outside. Another EXPLOSION rocks the room. Agu's eyes fill with dread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAN #2                         MAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if they are Army they       Shut up!    Shut up! will just be shooting us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering to Agu) Do not be listening to them, Agu. No matter what happens, this is how God tests us, we must be strong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHRIEK startles them. Outside, SOLDIERS scream ORDERS t each other. They are VERY near.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through his teeth) I am rather to be outside than to just be dying like animal inside!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men murmur in agreement. Father sees a GOVERNMENT ARMY TA turn the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We stay here, outside we die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we are running now, none of us will be having a chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody says anything. Then... BANG. Another shot. Father looks and sees ONE MORE downed Government Soldier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM. B-BOOM. The tank fires into their building. Rocking structure and raining down water and chunks of cement. Al their ears are ringing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are killing us all!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu is shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you are running fast, then the soldier won't be seeing you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu looks between his Father and Big Brother. His eyes tearing, his stomach churning with fear and nausea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, quiet, they will be hearing us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They break the door open. Light, air, and sounds pour int the room. Everyone SIGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BULLETS obliterate the three men by the door. GOVERNMENT SOLDIERS appear in the doorway, everyone throws their han up in surrender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu, Big Brother, Father, Grandfather and several of the sit on the ground with their hands on their heads. THREE GOVERNMENT ARMY SOLDIERS hold them at gun point, prodding them, shoving their heads, toying with them and tying the up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu notices that some of the NRC SOLDIERS ARE CHILDREN ju couple years older than himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GOVERNMENT ARMY SERGEANT interrogates them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which faction are you fighting for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are not fighters. We are from this town. We were protecting the stores.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are Native Defense Forces?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I am a Section Chief. We were tasked to stop looters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his Corporal) Bring the woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are calling us looters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOVERNMENT ARMY Soldiers exit buildings and connecting streets carrying looted goods. They dump them into their trucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corporal returns with the OLD WOMAN from his jeep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know these men?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old woman looks at Father, then at Agu and his brothe She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not know them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MEN all YELL in protest. Agu looks angrily at the wretched woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This woman, everyone knows she is crazy. Just talk to her, Massah, you will see she is not right in the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are not from here, they must be rebels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men protest. The Sergeant nods gravely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We, the armed forces of the National Reformation Council, find you to be spies and sentence you to immediate and summary execution. (to the soldiers around

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waste them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at his boys) Run!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men rise, those who haven't been tied yet put their h up and back away as the Government Army Soldiers shoot th to the ground, point blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu and Big Brother run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu dodges around a corner as a bullet hits the wall besi him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Safely around the corner, he stops and looks over for Big Brother who was just a second ago behind him. Agu looks d Big Brother is lying face down in a pool of blood. Agu reaches for his Big Brother as his body is pelted by bull

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reloading, they see Agu frozen in place. They aim to fire just as Agu regains his senses and runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu slams through the bush, branches scraping past him. H flip-flops slapping the red mud. Flinging it all over him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sounds of WAR gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu wanders on his own. Lost, confused, angry, his emotio overwhelming him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cries drunkenly, walking deeper into the wilds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu tries to sleep on a branch of a tree, he still cries mournful sob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu again wanders the intermittent bush and woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finds one rotten fruit hanging from a tree. Devours it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small babbling creek. Agu drinks water. The sounds of animals in the forest suffocating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu finds a hunting lodge of some kind. It has not been inhabited for some time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He digs through what's left. Finds some grains of rice in bottom of a basket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu has the grains of rice in an old pot with water. But cannot start a fire. He throws the pot in frustration, th immediately regrets it, running over to it to see if any the rice is left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cries again, more out of fatigue and hunger than sadne there is nothing else he knows to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries eating grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu, stomach in pain, vomits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tired, hungry, thirsty, Agu walks aimlessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees a BOY, just a bit older than him, lithe and dark coal, in tribal dress, a thin stemmed flower head dress o his crown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu, stops, unsure if he is real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A forest spirit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy runs away. Agu follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu crests the hill and into the valley below. He looks b the boy is gone. He runs deeper down a path leading into forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the forest animals go unusually quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu stops. Looks around. The forest is dark and unwelcome looms over him, seeming to grow taller in his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bends down into the tall grass, watching the forest se to move. Frightened, Agu lowers himself further, listenin watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SILENCE. The forest seems to move from inside. He freezes the hair tingling on the back of his neck, his mouth stil wrenched from crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOOTSTEPS. GRASS RUSTLES. FOOTSTEPS LOUDER. Then, MACHINE FIRE zips over his head. The thick grass cut and pecked b bullets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEN rush and pounce past him but he cannot see them, he c only hear their desperation and equipment clanking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu sees TWO PLF Rebels cresting the ridge line. POP POP, they drop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to see where the shot came from just in time to a SMALL BOY -- machete in hand, a shortened rifle strappe his back -- in mid-air jumping at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM. The boy's foot lands with a thud on Agu's raised ar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu SCREAMS, sure he has been killed, tries crawling away turns and looks. The BOY whacks him with the broad side o the machete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu SCREAMS and CRIES harder, curling like a beaten dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy hits him again and Agu relents. He sees a vision makes him sure he is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what death is feeling like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the forest, a surreal spectacle: 50 NATIVE DEFENSE FORCE (NDF) SOLDIERS --- not GOVERNMENT or PLF REBEL --- emerge from the edge of the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look like they are wearing the costumes of some trib warrior ceremony. Their heads and bodies in elaborate gra wraps and crowns, amulets hang from their bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ONE is stark NAKED except for lengths of belt-fed bullet chain wrapped around his body and leading into his GPMG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are ALL young, in their twenties, some boys in their teens and even younger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu, hypnotized by their colorful, yet vigilant and poten presence, is in awe, until another BOOT pins him to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANDS roughly turn him over. His shirt is yanked over his head and used to tie his arms behind his back. He is shov again, YELLED at, TAUNTED, until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOMEONE is approaching from behind them, the NDF Soldiers finish tying Agu's arms, then step back in respect and wa a MAN pass, followed by an ENTOURAGE OF 10 more NDF Soldi his AIDE, CHIEF SECURITY OFFICER, BODY GUARDS, and CONTRO GUARD (a MAN who holds what equates to a Roman Eagle Staf adorned in tribal motifs) as well as a contingent of his SMALL BOY UNIT (SBU).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This MAN moves slowly, like someone who can afford to tak his time. His clothing tribal with a distinctive chief-li flare to it. There is no question, he is the boss, he is their COMMANDANT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is this thing here on the ground? (no one responds) Who is catching this thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BOY who attacked Agu salutes Commandant. The Commanda addresses him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strika. Is it you who is finding this thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strika nods his head proudly. Agu avoids looking at Strik he passes him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enh! Strika? Untie him. (to the other NDF Soldiers) So all of you grown men here, and it is Strika who is finding a prisoner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kneels down next to Agu as more men emerge from the bu carrying clothing and loot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (addressing Strika but

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you finding him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strika points to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here? Is that right... where is Two- I-C? Two-I-C!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant looks at FAST KILL and BONE, two of his BODYGUARDS. They yell as the human telephone courses deep into the bush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-I-C!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the rustling grass, a THIN MAN emerges with a sma SQUAD of MEN. His skin sweaty and yellow like tanned leat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant, sah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Commandant motions for him to approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we to be doing with this thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This thing? It is just a boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-I-C is about to explain when Commandant raises his fi to quiet him. Now addressing him in front of the soldiers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A boy is nothing? A boy is harmless?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant looks at the NDF Small Boy Unit Soldiers near They scream in unison...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harmless no, sah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does a boy not have eyes to see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two eyes, sah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A boy has hands to strangle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NDF SBU Soldiers laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And fingers to pull a trigger. BUAH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant simulates firing a gun towards the bush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A boy is not harmless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A boy is very dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strika, are you trying to be eating this boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strika shakes his head no, smiling devilishly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am looking at you. You are not seeming like soldier to me. Show me your fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu raises his open hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your hands are like babies hands. What were you doing here? Why are you just laying by the ground like one dead rat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sah? We need to be move-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are from Alpha Town?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu nods, shyly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should be telling me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-I-C swears under his breath while looking nervously a black smoke rising above the trees in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell me and I will be helping you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father is telling me to run. Run far far so the Army Soldier is not catching me and killing me. And then, and then I am just hiding in the bush and running running...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And where is this your father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu cannot form the words, but the thought of it again an and saddens him. Commandant scratches his chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alpha Town? The army is killing your father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu nods, still looking at the Commandant's pistol. The Commandant leans down towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have just come from Alpha Town. It is burned to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu shakes his head, he feels waves of emotion swelling inside of his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu nods yes. He bites his lips, trying to hold back tear

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirsty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu nods yes, again. Commandant motions to Strika, who immediately runs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you are wanting drink, you will drink, but that is having to wait until you are telling me your name. Are you hearing me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu nods, tears streaming involuntarily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody is calling me Commandant. What is everybody always calling you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it like you are proud of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu, enh? Well, that is what I will be calling you then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strika returns with a bag of water. He gives it to Commandant, he tosses it to Agu. Agu tears the corner of water bag with his teeth and drains the water from the ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-I-C scoffs. Agu looks back and forth between the two them, he does not know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave this one with me. I will take this one under my charge, turn him into a warrior. Is that what you want? Do you want to be fighting the Army that is killing your father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu nods. Two-I-C has had enough...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Formation!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should be saying yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say yes, sah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Commandant squints in approval, turns away and walks towards the front of his men. He nods to Two-I-C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other NDF Soldiers follow suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C/O RAMBO, a dark and muscular COMPANY COMMANDER with sha eyes and a red bandana (like the real Rambo), pushes Agu line and places several heavy bands of ammunition over hi shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next in line are a DOZEN CIVILIANS who carry generators, jerry cans, palm oil, water, rice bags and other looted g for the NDF soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother, glory be to God in the Highest. I am still living... but I am soldier now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant's NDF Soldiers march through the jungle. Agu struggles under the weight of his load but keeps pace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is deathly quiet, the sounds of the jungle, the birds, the insects, buzz over the creaking of trees under heat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NDF, in a long single file line, snake their way past several waterfalls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nature is alive everywhere around them. They seem to move like they are invisible to all the animals in the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu concentrates on moving his feet through the wet underbrush, wary of the animals that could bite him. A gr shadow sweeps over them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu looks up to see the blades of a helicopter, so large seems to move in slow motion. He stares at it in hypnotic wonder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he looks down, he sees that all the NDF Soldiers hav dived for cover. Rambo pulls Agu down into the underbrush is calm, but he whispers to Agu...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Botu botu botu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to the helicopter in the sky, then slides his finger over his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu looks up at it again, his face gaunt with hunger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Botu botu botu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the front of the line, Commandant raises his hand and everyone stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An NDF SCOUT steps out from behind a tree. They salute ea other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rambo taps Agu's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu dumps the ammunition and grabs a plastic jug of water distribute to the soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the head of the line Commandant picks up a thick baton like stick from between the tall ribboned roots of a gian buttress tree. He swings the baton into a ribbon and it B like a bass drum, the entire trunk turned into a resonato

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE WIDE above the canopy of the jungle as the tree, wh looms over the other trees, reverberates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound startles Agu in the midst of pouring a cup of w for a soldier, GRIOT. The naked warrior, TRIPOD, stomps p him. He looks like a giant next to Agu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant and everyone wait. BOOM BOOM - a distant retor response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant signals his men to move forward. Agu runs back pick up the bands of ammunition as the troops now move ah past Commandant up the valley walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NDF soldiers file past an entrenched bunker that looks ou over the valley. An NDF PICKET fires in the air, announci and celebrating their return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant, Agu and the rest of the company exit the dens woods, revealing an extensive camp housing 400 NDF combatants. It is constructed from a mixture of older tha huts and lean-tos, haphazardly dispersed in a covered sec of the jungle with a parade ground at its center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An open grass field lies just beyond where soldiers play football.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NDF Soldiers greet their COMRADES who also fire into air in celebration, as well as handing over loot and good carried by the CIVILIANS to the CHIEF SUPPLY OFFICER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of the soldiers disperse into their places in ca Some continue conversing with friends as they remove all their heavy equipment, some slouch into corners to relax rest, others light joints and take other sundry drugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant hands Agu over to Two-I-C for deployment. Two- busy with the CIVILIAN PORTERS, ignores Agu until he is d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Civilians) ...to protect life and property. If you are wanting to stay, then stay, but you must be initiated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All agree to stay. Two-I-C looks down at Agu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-I-C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, suh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This baby boy is your responsibility now. Train him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant salutes and walks away with his detail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sah. (yelling to another) C/O Hope!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope runs up to Two-I-C and salutes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, suh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This baby boy is your responsibility now. Train him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-I-C points to Agu and walks away. Hope appraises Agu dispassionately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A COOK, holding a dog and smoking a cigarette, dispenses and sauce from the back of a hut to Hope and his NDF Smal Boy Unit Soldiers. Others exchange cartons of cigarettes other extras, peppers and juicier cassava chunks and more rice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEN NDF SBU Soldiers, including the boys Strika, Hope, Gr (17), PREACHER (16), JUSTICE (13) and CHICKEN LEGS (15) collect their ration and sit around a fire to eat. Agu is ignored. He has no bowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu, hungry, watches them with hawkish and ravenous eyes. They use their fingers, licking every last drop of food. Preacher sings a song as he finishes his bowl of food and lets it drop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu dives for it. He runs to where the cook was dispersin food but there is none left. The DOG, the Cook's pet, lic the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Despondent, he uses his hands to gather what little is le in his own bowl, then drops to the level of the dog and competes for scraps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An NDF Soldier, Chicken Legs, chastises Agu...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enh? What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I carried ammunition and water all day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you are a soldier now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is kicked back away from the pot by the COOK holding h dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stealing from a dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one of you is the dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers chuckle as Agu retreats. Commandant, wearing HOODED CAP, calls Strika to him while holding out extra f Agu watches him go enviously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu and 75 other NDF Soldiers are spread out, advancing slowly in a crouched position. The CIVILIANS (who were porters) and Agu use wooden weapons, the rest real rifles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the battlefield, do not expect to be thinking normally. The only thing mattering is the mission of the NDF. Fight and kill anyone who destroys the peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCARECROW effigies are lined up on pikes for target pract

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother, I am not knowing if I will ever be seeing you again. But Two-I- C is saying small small we are winning this war, and then, God willing, I can be finding you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant observes the new recruits as he relaxes with h head in his improvised refrigerator/air conditioning unit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are calling him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Preacher leans in towards Agu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man who is driving the enemy to madness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rambo repositions them. Griot adjusts Agu's stance, in reference to Commandant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is treating death like lover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu sees COMMANDANT, surrounded by subordinates in a tent talking in relaxed fashion in the heat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu listens as Hope and the other SBU soldiers clean thei rifles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is eating people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not eating people, Hope-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope, caught off guard, as Commandant passes with TWO of BODYGUARDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can eat a man and take their power, it is true, but I taste their fear in the meats. I can take their juju just by looking at them in the eyes, so why must I eat their fear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He makes a chomping with his jaw towards Hope, which make him jump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant laughs. As he leaves he pats Strika on the hea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu listens to Commandant amongst the full battalion of N soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Native Defense Forces!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strong, proud, and intelligent!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does the Commandant look?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant enjoys these moments with his men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu and SEVEN NEW NDF SOLDIERS sit in a tight circle as T C rattles off a complex breakdown of the war's politics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...weakened by the PLF's outside pressure. The National Reformation Council took advantage of this instability and militarily seized power to restore UPC dominance. We NDF refuse to recognize this illegitimate government.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu, THREE ADOLESCENTS, and NINE CIVILIANS stand in a sma opening in the jungle, a thatched fence, some 20 meters i diameter, fends off the jungle. Effigies and human skulls adorn the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In front of them are smoky fires boiling medicinal pots a drying herbs on a thatch platform placed several feet ove the fires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chanting CHIEF PRIEST leans in close to Agu's face. THR INITIATORS inscribe messages from the Koran with black in wooden tablets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rains are coming, Gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are knowing what that is meaning. Mosquitoes, sickness, muddy squalor. Suffering if we are caught with our "soldiers" hanging out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men laugh at the "penis" allusion, but they know the rains mean change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the Junta will tell the international community that we NDF are the reason this war continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, Hope, and you, Rambo, you are not from the same tribe as him. (he points towards Hope) But you are brothers before your enemy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope, Rambo and the troops hum in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What drove us to this larger family of strangers? Fear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: War?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Sah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu is perplexed by Two-I-C's explanations, the politics beyond his understandings of the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PLF could join the NRC, it would legitimize their cause, make us the sole enemy, and give them freedom to roam formerly Government controlled areas of the nation in policing actions. If this were...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu is swept away with Commandant, the spectacle, the reactions from the other soldiers he enjoys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have defended ourselves against criminal rapings and killings of our own people, first by the PLF, and now by the NRC government.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men grow dark with this thought. Commandant seizes th sadness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this has awakened a sleeping beast, Gentlemen. It has put the weapons of this war in the hands of you, the young, and therefore, the powerful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to Agu, who raises his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of you, who were never listened to before, who have seen your loved ones gunned down, you have something that speaks for you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men raise their rifles, growling a low pitched battle chant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu and the initiates sit on the raised platforms engulfe smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The new regime needs to control the trade in resources for the international community to waste time recognizing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the INITIATORS lays a variety of leaves on the fir below them as the SCRIBES wash the wooden tablets into a large enamel bowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, the colonists have never left Africa. Our very own politicians will steal our resources and give them away for pennies in exchange for private payoffs...but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are licking their wounds. They are feeling our sting. We, along with our other brothers fighting further south under Dada Goodblood, we command and control what the NRC needs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Grass People in the South East control the lumber and gold, the Clay and Charcoal people in the South West, diamonds and rare metals, and the Coastal people, petroleum and fisheries. This is the reason the NRC are trying so hard to be calling themselves a "reformation council."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reformation of what? Money. Old men and money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have spit on the constitution. They have spit on your rights. They have tried to spit on your future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: War has spoiled their minds, Gentlemen. So they could have "their turn to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu and the initiates are laid down in the open shallow graves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The INITIATORS take the gray water from the enamel bowl a place the liquid into small bottles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: War is a disease. It sickens and infects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans down in front of a particularly fierce looking soldier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to be a "big man", or a "small boy"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men laugh nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu lays in the grave in a haze of smoke and fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is why we must not forget that we are the protectors of the people!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The richness of our nation is for the young.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When there is an infection in your foot. A deadly deathly sickness in your limb that's going to kill you slow slow, what do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men do not know. One in the back yells out "you go to doctor!" Generating a chuckle amongst other men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So maybe they should be calling us the doctor army and not the hunter army? We have to be cutting off that leg to save the body. That is how you prevent the NRC/PLF infection from spreading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOAT and CHICKEN sacrifices are made and stones are burie the INITIATORS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chief Priest pulls Agu out of the grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must die before you are reborn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow we mobilize for major action, uniting all of our brother warriors under Supreme Commander Dada Goodblood, and with God's blessing, end this plague, end this war, end our oppression!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu is forced to run a gauntlet through a line of NDF MEN with sticks, branches, and clubs. He is hit hard and with mercy, landing on the other end with his arms battered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ONE of the initiates falls from a blow to the head and Ag watches in horror as he is quickly dispatched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men, aroused and growing in fury, grow louder as his speech culminates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young men! Gentlemen! We will not wait to inherit it, we will not wait for them to just give it to us, we will take it, we will seize it from their rotting and decaying old hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu looks at the charred remains of the MAN who they dispatched on the smoking platform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victory!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu and the NDF Soldiers yell even louder, some FIRING in the air in celebration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victory!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu raises his fist in the air, swept by the energy and f of Commandant's speech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CHIEF PRIEST gathers the charred pieces into a bowl a creates a paste from it. He performs a last ceremony with cleansed initiates, slicing Agu's triceps, calves, back o his neck. He rubs the charcoal paste and medicinal herbs the cuts. Then places amulets (bracelets, necklaces with small bottles of ink, et al) on those cuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The initiates are lined up. Commandant steps forward with BODY GUARDS, they pump their SHOTGUNS and fire into the initiates. They flinch but the bullets do not touch them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chief Priest blesses them one last time. In each of t mouths he places a ball of mashed rice (like mochi).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu, voraciously eating, hears the Chief Priest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat the enemy if you bring him down. Become braver, his heart becomes your medicine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spirits have blessed you and cleansed you. To the enemy, you are invincible. But there are rules you must follow to keep the spirits happy, to remain pure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sex with women. No touching women. No talking to women. Stay pure. No looting. No touching dead bodies. No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu gathers supplies from the structures of the camp, Commandant stands over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu, you are a soldier now. The only way is forward. Do not be leaving any nice thing for the NRC or the PLF to be using if they are coming to this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Griot and Preacher poor kerosene as well over other build as we PAN and see the entire battalion is lighting up the camp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Advancing in the rainy season?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone will be on zero-zero-one now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope shakes his head and grumbles to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is zero-zero-one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is meaning you, me, we all be hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means no breakfast, no lunch, only dinner. If you are wanting to eat when it is not dinner, then you are having to keep your dinner from before to be eating the next day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or if we raiding or finding farm, then we can be eating what we find. Cow, chicken, baby... woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FIRE roars to the sky, as their structures and shelte catch fire, the SOLDIERS start to file out of their camp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COOK hands one baseball sized ball of garri to each soldi including Agu, who smells it then quickly stows it in his rice bag backpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NDF Soldiers disinter weapons and ammunitions caches wrap in plastic, stored from many weeks previous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are knowing this tree?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu sticks with Preacher, following him where ever he goe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is Iroko. These other trees I am not knowing, but I am calling them children of the forest because they are smaller than the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NDF decorate themselves with grass and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When this tree is small, it is looking so so like a cassava plant, except that it has thorns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant and Agu stand under a tall tree, Commandant se genuinely overwhelmed and inspired by the scale of nature

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is even having a root like a cassava, but if you eat it, it will kill you with its poison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu hadn't learned that before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is why you must be knowing how to use your thorns. You kill before you are killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu nods, watching the wind sway the tops of the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will see the enemy is having small boy soldiers, too, who can kill before they can even speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu turns back to the Commandant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have seen them do things that are even making the Devil fall to his knee to beg for mercy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu nods, thinking he understands the analogy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you killed a man before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will. Today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu salutes. Realization delayed. Commandant nods, please

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant goes to his Aide holding out a radio. Behind, entourage has laid a map on the ground to study.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will destroy anything that threatens us. As I would anything that threatens you, understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu nods anxiously, his pride boosted. Commandant picks u his VHF Radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his radio) Two-I-C, report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, queasily, he sees Hope and Chicken Legs watching hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, killing is easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, you already eating a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think was that ball of garri, the one you are eating in initiation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu, disgusted, notices Strika. His rifle dangling in his arms. He watches Agu blankly, Agu looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feeling Strika's eyes still on him, Agu looks back, and Strika is right next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up a fruit foraged from the jungle. He breaks of piece, an offering, and shares it with a grateful but ner Agu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chicken Legs pantomimes eating and touching a satiated be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NDF Soldiers tear through the jungle towards its ligh edge. They hop scotch positions, some kneeling and coveri while others move forward and spread out with speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The choreography dazzles Agu, turning around to watch, Preacher grabs his collar and reorients him to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant motioning with his hand, VHF RADIO in the othe down the command chain, C/O's, and Platoon Commanders eac silently communicating hand orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu runs with his Small Boy Unit past Commandant's positi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In an ambush you don't make a sound. You get injured, you don't make a sound. You see a snake, you don't make a sound. You get bitten by a snake, you don't make a sound. You shut up! You take it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SBU spill out onto the road with limited commotion. A looks back to where they just came from, seeing nothing b green and a stretch of road 300 meters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu watches the boys of his unit sniff a brown crystal po (brown-brown) while waiting in a ditch of foliage on the other side of the road from the main ambush force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
