dialogues.text: Strika chews on a long root, Agu whispers to him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are calling you Strika?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strika nods, putting his finger up to his lips to communi "silence".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you liking war?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, with a nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you liking killing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indifferent, with a shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it easying to be doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you fearing death?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, with a shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you having parent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am still having mother. Somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strika continues to chew on the root.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that you are chewing on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strika rubs his belly as if to say it will make it feel better. He shares it with Agu, who puts it in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you liking Commandant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you stupid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strika looks at Agu like he could punch him. He snatches root back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you not talking, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Griot hands the two boys a plastic container.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morale booster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu smells it. Nauseating. Chicken Legs stifles a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is good juju, making you stronger and braver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu sniffs, then as it drips down his throat, tries to sp out the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is tasting like licking rock. (smacking his tongue) And eating pencil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope listens to his VHF Radio, turns to the rest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh. They are coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu notices all of the BOYS are lowering themselves even further into the bushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Preacher posted behind a giant, red-dust-covered leaf, hi at Agu, covered in ammunition belts, to scoot down with h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu notices the sudden stillness of everything, the only movement a swarm of mosquitoes descending upon them, he t to beat them away. Then he feels breathing on his neck an turns slowly to see it is Strika.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strika motions, signaling him to focus down the road. The wafts in translucent tendrils over the pavement. Then he it, rounding a bend, the dust cloud of a CONVOY of TRUCKS LIGHT ARMORED VEHICLES rolling in their direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am almost laughing and almost dying, even though I am not feeling like laughing. Inside my stomach and heart it is feeling like fire from a pepper. I am only thinking about what is going to be happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three trucks becomes FOUR TRUCKS, then FIVE. Large Calibe machine guns are mounted on some of them, as well as GOVERNMENT TROOPS who look out into the green margins of road with distrust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ground shakes as they roll over Agu's position. The wheels nearly as tall as Agu would be standing next to th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone waits in anticipation, biting lips and focused a the last truck passes Agu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SQUAD of SBU-NDF SOLDIERS scurry across the road like a fleeing deer. Only one stays behind, CHICKEN LEGS, stoppi turning, revealing, an RPG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PLF DRIVER, realizing, slams on the breaks. Grinds th transmission into a lower gear, then neutral, fighting to it into reverse when. ZWOOOF -- the RPG slams into his ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM. The first truck's engine compartment shatters in a storm of shrapnel, fire and smoke into the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope signals aggressively. The SBU rushes onto the road dragging SPIKE STRIPS, RPGs and GPMGs. They ensure no retreat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a second, nothing happens. Agu closes his ears, expec more gun fire, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GOVERNMENT TROOPS hold their rifles into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ONE MAN in the convoy yells out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please do not shoot us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu grips his machete harder. Sweat beads all over his fa He looks around petrified, confused, excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the floor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu sees SEVENTY NDF SOLDIERS emerge from the jungle, ANNOUNCING their presence with an echoing BARK. An impres show of scale of force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu, where is the fucking ammunition?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu remembers he forgot the extra ammunition. He scramble back down into the ditch as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KPWAP! Agu flinches and ducks. Someone in the bush sprays truck, bullets ricochet off of the metal door of the midd truck, a windshield is shattered. Then all the NDF soldie open fire. It is a quick and effective slaughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu holds his ears. It all happened so quickly he didn't the full carnage, but when he gets up, the trucks are che up and the men inside are dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disarm and disrobe them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rambo repeats the CALL, moves forward with another SBU sq

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of the Government Soldiers are crying, as Rambo's me kick away the weapons and yank off their clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant, his ENTOURAGE, and CONTROLLER, emerge from th bush with guns aimed and ready. He is proud of the catch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upon seeing him, NDF SQUADS move up the road to secure th front and down the road to secure their tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SBU moves to join the CENTER. Agu walks past a few tr and stripped soldiers with necks strained towards death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope grabs Griot and Preacher, jumps into the back of a t and looks around, throwing useless items over the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant and his entourage look for a healthy man and a disappointed by all the dead men. Finally, they find one, CORPORAL, alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant's Body Guards drag him to Agu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu, come here, enh. Come here right now. Come here. These are the dogs who killed your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu looks disdainfully at the man quivering on the ground beneath Commandant, blabbering incomprehensibly, shaking head at Agu. Agu's nerves fire off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the corner of his eye, ONE GOVERNMENT SOLDIER runs the bush. He is nearly naked, his body glistens with his comrades' blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one seems to mind. Then, MUZZLE FLASHES out of the bus at the end of the road. KWAP, KWAP-KWAP. Flesh explodes f the man's thigh and scatters to the ground. He falls with screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our attention returns to the man held in front of Agu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu, you will kill this man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corporal moans dreadfully, pissing himself as he crie The pool of urine from him and from Commandant is all aro his flip-flops, mixing with blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Sah. I am an engineering student from the university in the capital. I am supposed to be fixing bridges, not be a soldier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears and snot run down his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't be killing me. Just be making me your prisoner. Please, I can be helping you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope jumps into the SECOND truck with a fist full of maps Griot follows him holding a box and offering it to Commandant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant and his entourage step back a little bit, just case it's booby-trapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Griot holds up a surveying scope. He offers it to Command who turns it around when his Aide interrupts and hands Commandant his rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, this won't do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pistol?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is too easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not the cutlass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does he have the strength?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at Agu, who looks back, lost. They discuss amon themselves, then point at his machete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rambo, seize him, hold his ass to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant unzips his pants and urinates on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu. See this thirsty goat. These are the tyrants who murdered your father. (back to the Corporal) Now look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu grips his machete harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POP. POP-POP The NDF Soldiers shoot NRC survivors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember what they have taken from you. Remember your suffering and turn it into hate for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NDF Soldiers, having finished off the survivors, collect supplies and check the function of the engines of the vehicles. They start to transfer supplies onto the lighte vehicles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Agu's ear) God and the spirit of your Father is wanting you to kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant grabs Agu's hand, the one holding the machete squeezes his own hand around Agu's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like this. Just bring this hand up and knock him well well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes Agu's hand and raises it high. Agu stares into t petrified man's eyes. He looks at his feet, urine and blo splattered on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Use all of your force, imagine the blade sinking deep into him like chopping a coconut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu's face grimaces, as he gathers all his strength, he s fiercely into the corporal's head. The blade splits the s on the man's forehead and gashes his skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man screams an unbearable, screeching, grating sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! That is how you are dealing with the NRC. Do it again! And again and again until he shuts up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NDF Soldiers hold the Corporal up, goading Agu on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu brings the machete up, swings it hard. KWOMP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man's screams as sound grows dim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu chops again. The THUD vibrates up his arm, droplets o blood suspend in the air and sparkle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anger, memories of his father and his brother, gunned dow the street fueling anger he didn't know he could muster starts swinging harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strika walks over with his rifle and helps Agu. Together, they stomp and cut with increasing furry and vigor until man's face becomes unrecognizable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu, suddenly feeling sick, rushes to the grass to vomit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant pulls him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch his blood, Agu. That is justice. That is what God wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu looks up at Commandant, then at Strika. Common understanding, mutual blame, between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu wipes the blood from his face, the NDF Soldiers celebrate, firing into the air, SING and dance around the dead government soldiers. It is a great victory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother, I have kill a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mosquito drowns in blood. No one notices this but Agu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is the bad sin and I am feeling like I am dying inside, like each breath can be my last and my heart will stop its beating. But I am knowing, too, it is the right thing to be doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NDF SOLDIERS SING A RHYTHMIC SONG while organizing the lo clothing and weapons. SEVERAL are already dressed in the clothes taken from the Government Soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu and Strika dig through one of the vehicles looking fo any contraband. Agu finds CIGARETTES under a seat and sho them to Strika.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO CIVILIAN TRUCKS arrive from down the road loaded with SQUADS of Commandant's NDF forward strike troops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mechanics fix the engines of the lighter convoy vehicles. Supplies are finished loading. Platoons and Companies re- organize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Machine guns and anti-aircraft guns are mounted on the trucks, turning them into improvised attack trucks: a.k.a TECHNICALS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-I-C hands Commandant one of the Government Soldier's nicer FN-FAL RIFLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant checks the chamber, looks down the barrel from breech, replaces the loaded clip into it, turns towards A and gives it to him. Two-I-C is surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always keep it with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you are losing it, then I will be losing you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant winks at him to affirm their pact. Strika approaches with some captured Army accoutrements in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are my Special Guards now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strika stands at attention and salutes affirmation, as do Agu, mimicking Strika.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his CSO) CSO. Take note and act accordingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu and Strika are now my Special Guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CSO, not knowing what that actually means, just agrees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, suh. Special Guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu sits down with his rifle, looking at it proudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always be keeping it. If you are losing it, then they will be losing you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strika tosses Agu a pair of green army pants and an ammunition vest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu holds them up. Far too large but he tries them on any using a piece of hemp as a belt. He looks up to thank Str but he is already chasing after Commandant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NDF Convoy cuts through the rolling countryside, past burnt frames of vehicles. Agu rides with Strika in the ba of Commandant's truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NDF SBU Soldiers spread out in the bush, scavenge for foo Agu and Strika play, a rare glimpse of childish fun for t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope and Griot chop through the plants when suddenly a BU RAT dashes out of its hiding spot. Excited, they swing th rifles around and OPEN FIRE, killing it and nearly killin each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu and the other SBU run to see what they shot when the of the CONTROLLER sounds off, like the WHISTLE of a tea kettle, heralding the distant thumping of a HELICOPTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen! Cover! Cover!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu looks at Strika.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cover!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Botu, botu, botu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vehicles are quickly covered with natural camouflage and netting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE WIDE: the NDF BATTALION kneels, disappearing into t bush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu, in the taller grass with Strika, Justice, Chicken Le Hope, Griot, and Preacher, watches the sky through the bl apprehensively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound, its proximity unclear, suddenly nears. It circ its THUMPING dangerously near. Agu can see the rocket launchers on its miniature wings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu and Strika lay on the ground, staring into the face o the dead rat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems like at any second they could all be destroyed, just as suddenly, the sound of the helicopter fades and i gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Safe, they breath in relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Small Boys Unit laugh quietly. Commandant sits with t at the fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...ooh, and they are having so many foods to be eating...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu salivates, he is as hungry as those listening...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...chicken, and cow, and goat, and vegetable, and fruit, any kind of fish you are wanting because the fishermen are always bringing everything from the sea. There is nothing they are not having in this place...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire twinkles in all the NDF Soldier's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The best thing this town, this town of abundant resources, is all the womens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men smile to themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, woman in this place are just too beautiful. If you just see women here, before you are even knowing it, your soldier is standing at full `tenshun. They are having breasts so soft and so round that their clothes are rejoicing to be holding them. And they are having bottoms with specs so nice that anytime they are sitting down, the ground is also rejoicing. They are knowing well well how to make a man feel good with their kissing and loving, kai! The last time I am in this place, enh, my soldier is hurting too much for me to even be easing myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all will see, because that is where we are going, gentlemen. You will see it all with your own eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men's eyes glaze over deliriously staring into the fi Then a SOUND causes them all to turn, weapons up in defen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 12 CIVILIAN REFUGEES stare in bewilderment at their encampment, followed by two NDF PICKETS who salute Commandant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Refugees, sir. They say the PLF and the NRC took their village three days ago. They killed most, but let these ones go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant stews on the intel. The SBU watch him, waiting him to make a decision -- will it be battle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let us be giving their village back, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE WIDE over a burnt out village. Civilian trucks and smolder. A BATTLE is raging. From across town we see that PLF defend a hill that the NDF are advancing on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant watches the progress through his SURVEYOR SCOP The NDF are held at bay by an RPG attack. They respond wi fierce fire. Moving in open against bullets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant's main entourage all kneel behind him in the l THREE squads in defensive positions beyond them. Agu and rest of the SBU stand near an unfinished wall. The sound the occasional passing bullet shocks no one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering to Agu) See what the PLF does to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope points to a line of DEAD CIVILIANS. Their hands chop off on a rock next to them. A WOMAN and a CHILD lay on th street, as if they laid down where they stood to take a n and never got up. The woman's head unnaturally propped up against the wall staring permanently at her twisted feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BULLET zips past and ricochets off the wall next to Agu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu looks around. He notices the smashed bullet at his fe Just as he bends over to pick it up, where his head would have been, a bullet smashes into the wall. No one seems interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his radio) Two-I-C?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are facing heavy fire, suh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you take the bridge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, suh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Explain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very difficult, suh. Our     men are fighting bravely but-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But nothing. Take the bridge, that is your task.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant motions for the MORTAR MAN to set up a mortar help the HILL ADVANCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-I-C and his forward operation team are hunkered down behind a building facing a PLF stronghold -- TWO MACHINE nests with sand bags in front of the heavily defended bri which looks like a former check point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need support, suh. The men's spirts are low, suh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Two-I-C there is general chaos. The men are not advancing and many are retreating. JUSTICE is yelling at men around him to help him carry an injured RAMBO to safe but no one will help him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is driven to tears in the chaos, spinning in circles trying to get a grown-up to help him as Rambo bleeds out the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sustain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant lets his radio hang around his neck, watching HILL BATTLE progress again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu, Strika, come here. Look at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu and Strika obey. Commandant holds the scope up for th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a very special device, you can be seeing the enemy with it, even when they are hiding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu, through the scope, sees the FORWARD STRIKE NDF SOLDI unload and disperse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He motions for the mortar to fire. Agu looks through it w the first blasts force the PLF to scurry. Strika, impatie for his try, paces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's magic. (to the men) I need volunteers! Who has heart? Who wants to fight with me? Who isn't afraid of bullets!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men ROAR BACK in affirmation. Commandant moves amongs the men, placing his hand on their chest, feeling their hearts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When it's Strika's turn to look, Commandant interrupts hi try by asking him if he has heart for battle. Conflicted between wanting to try out the scope and the call for bat he affirms he is ready to fight while the "toy" is put aw by the Aide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant selects men and boys to go with him, those who aren't selected are pushed aside and kneel down in shame disappointment. Amongst the selected are Agu, Strika, Hop Chicken Legs, and Griot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An AA technical rushes back around the market towards the intersection under a hailstorm of bullets and clouds of smoke, PREACHER is in the back firing back with RANDY and couple other SBU's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Technical screeches into position at the top of the intersection leading to the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chicken Legs, go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chicken Legs runs to the intersection with Griot in suppo to fire an RPG down on the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SELECTED TEAM, about 20 MEN and SBUs, advance towards bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant CHANTS a war chant, "no retreat, no surrender, dropping, men moving". The men respond to the CHANT, all them, a battle cry that rouses. They keep huffing into th chant as Commandant addresses them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These bullets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WHISTLE of bullets increases and, where most rational would duck, has no affect on Commandant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are nothing. No one can touch us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Commandant pulls a chanting Agu up near him and uses as an example.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you afraid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu shakes his head, even if inside he is afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant, along with Tripod and the Controller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moove it!    Gentlemen! Moooooove it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NDF SOLDIERS YELL again. A NERVE TINGLING BATTLE CRY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No retreat! No surrender! Men dropping! Men moving!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bullets whistle by angrily. Then, a tidal wave of win and fire is laid down on them, tearing up a building's wa and wooden kiosks around them. The men do not flinch, the believe they cannot be hit, although some MEN do go down, majority continues the advance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu is astonished, but because everyone else keeps moving does he. To his left, Commandant smiles at him, loving th adrenaline of battle. TRIPOD prancing in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu, let me be see your aim, hit that man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu aims at a PLF running across the road. Pulls the trig Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu, it is on safety, what was Two- I-C teaching you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To always be leaving it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off. How will you be firing quickly if it is in safety? Enh? Listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant takes the rifle, looks for a clean shot at PLF fighters. KWAP-KWAP. A man goes down. He looks back at Ag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu, safety off, fires. It nearly knocks him off balance. looks at Strika and Commandant for approval, but their attention is on the PLF, who seem to be moving in from al directions now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu, Strika, Griot, Hope, Chicken Legs and Preacher all yelling at the tops of their lungs as they go forward tow the Rebel positions, increasing in speed, bravado, fearlessness and ferocity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the PLF Rebels near the bridge, a hidden NDF company ambushes them, on their heels, they rush back to the intersection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE FROM the PLF REBELS. See the TWO Companies Commanda sent around the sides spilling out onto the road on eithe side of town. They too storm the PLF position recklessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PLF, seeing they are surrounded, drop their weapons a run for the edge of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NDF advance turns into a sprint. The bravado works, a they drop more retreating rebels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bodies, weapons, and ammunitions scatter the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu looks for Commandant and Strika, his nervous system o fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu and the SBU patrol the edge of the town and jungle, picking up dropped supplies and loot from dead rebels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant stands over the bodies of SEVEN DEAD NDF SOLDI amongst them, RAMBO. Commandant looks like he feels great remorse. Preacher, bandaged but alive, says a prayer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ONE LIVE REBEL in underwear, arms tied behind his back, i being prodded by Chicken Legs and begging for his life. Chicken Legs shoots him in the hip. He falls, twitching. Chicken Legs enjoys his catch and takes his time finishin him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu notices that some of the RPG's are made of WOOD, as i they were theatrical props, he kicks one. Solid and dense

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM. Chicken Legs shoots the PLF prisoner again. He turn over, his life slowly draining from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu sees ANOTHER BODY laying face down and quickly starts searching his pockets. He takes the bandoliers, smells th water bottle, looks in his pack, brown-brown in a foil envelope, batteries, and a small ball of cloth tied up wi string.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He unravels it. Inside he finds GOLD NUGGETS. He looks at them curiously, unsure what they are, puts one in his mou bites it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM. Preacher finishes off the naked prisoner. His brain splattered on the pavement. No one seems to take note, by a common practice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu calls Strika and shows him the gold. Strika looks at warily, as if Agu shouldn't have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strika shakes his head and motions to follow him. Agu sig as he obliges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They salute and pass Commandant's body guard and enter an abandoned post office. Strika leaves Agu behind at the doorway of Commandant's room, motioning for him to go in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu listens as Commandant speaks via radio to SUPREME COMMANDER Dada Goodblood on the other end. It's a close conversation. Strategy. Something mentioned about an intersection of highways. Cut offs to the Capital. And Commandant being promoted, soon, to General.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His silhouette paces around in the lantern light. Maps ar laid out on the floor. He kneels down, studying them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu coughs, to call attention to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still studying the maps) Sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to his cot across the room. Agu enters, careful to step on any of the maps spread out on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu places the WAD WITH THE GOLD NUGGETS on Commandant's table, then obediently waits next to the cot, watching Commandant studying the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant stops, notices the wad, curious, opens it, dro its contents in his hands. He looks up at Agu, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fought bravely today, Agu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see what happens when the men listen to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant lays out a line of brown-brown. He snorts it a beckons Agu to do the same. Agu, having seen others do th knows how, but has never experienced it. He sniffs eagerl The Brown-brown going straight to his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are wanting to know how to be leading?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sah. I am happying to be following you, sah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His nose tingles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is good, Agu, because there is no learning to be leading. Some men is born to leading, other is born to following, and other is only waiting to be dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am following you, sah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Agu. You are different. You are reminding me of me when I was a little boy, and this means you are borning to be leader. But even the best leader Agu, must first be learning to be good follower. Sometimes I even have to be following the Supreme Commander, if when I am not agreeing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sah. I am a good follower, sah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant points at the map. Lines of two highways inter near the bottom center. He points at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are seeing this place. Supreme Commander is saying this is important. So it is important for me then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we get this place, then we can go to Taro. Is that where your mother is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am thinking she is in the Capital, sah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After Goodblood greets us, we all will be going to the Capital, that is a certainty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu nods. It is hard for him to think of her without feel emotions, and he doesn't want to show Commandant these childish emotions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am wanting to be helping you more than the others, Agu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Preacher SINGS somewhere in the encampment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But do not be telling anyone I am helping you like this, this will be our secret. Can you be keeping this secret, Agu?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with Commandant's attention, he is able to forget, fo this instance, his mother again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then be saying it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can be keeping this secret, sah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In this family where I am being father, we cannot have the other children getting jealous, Agu!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rubs Agu's head, roughly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kneel down in front of me. You do me this thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu, respectfully, kneels down in front of Commandant as blows out the lantern light. It is near darkness except f the campfires outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not punishing you, Agu. I am helping you, to care for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He touches Agu on his shoulder, then his hands drift down Agu's arm to his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what commanding officer is supposed to be doing to his best boy soldier. Play with him, cherish him, protect him, enh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He brings Agu's hand down towards his own genitals. Agu i too afraid to move. Commandant moves Agu's head towards h crotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Touch my soldier, Agu, with your mouth. This is a command. You took an oath to obey, and now obey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu's moves to do as he is told. We TILT AWAY AND UP to Commandant, leaning back and mentally departing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu's face appears out of the darkness, illuminated by th lantern lights. His face shows excruciating pain. Everyon already asleep, so he tries to walk quietly, but it is to painful. He whimpers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strika has been waiting for him. Agu collapses into Strik crying. Strika holds him. They lay amongst all the other Soldiers, who are already sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strika. He is my only friend, Mother. His eye are too red, his teeth are too brown, his head is too too big, but he is my friend even if he is looking too ugly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strika throws his arm around Agu, protecting him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The convoy has stopped in the middle of the country side. Everybody is prepping themselves for battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NDF Soldiers smoke their joints laced with powder, ot sniff brown-brown, while loading up ammunition and preppi for combat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one in the land we are going is your friend. They are the farmers who feed your enemy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope sees Agu hobbling in pain. Looks at him, assessing i is fit for battle or not. He takes a knife and cuts a sli along Agu's temple. Agu winces in even more pain as Hope smears brown-brown into its bloody abyss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The farmers' wives whose breasts feed babies who will grow to join the enemy ranks, whose wombs breed more of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant turns towards him, smiles. Agu, contrary to wh he would think, feels special under Commandant's gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men are kneeled around Commandant. Agu cannot make ey contact with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the nature of the place we are going. The homeland of the collaborators and traitors. Our people's blood has flowed for year. Now must their blood flow, too. Let us pray to the spirits and God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men circle around Commandant, chanting a prayer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, be guiding us in everything we are about to be doing. Give us the strength to fulfill your justice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men start DANCING around Commandant and SINGING a gru guttural war chant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they are moving out, a CONVOY OF WHITE "UN" VEHICLES s by down the Highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu looks curiously at one of the PASSENGERS, a WHITE WOM Time slows down so he can see her face staring back from behind the glass windows of the hermetically sealed air- conditioned van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WOMAN locks eyes with him, but instead of sympathy Ag sees fear in her face. This immediately angers him even i doesn't know why he is feeling angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the same time, a photographer in the back seat snaps photographs of him and the other NDF soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NDF soldiers yell at the convoy and point their rifle into the air, taunting. As it passes, it speeds up, leavi them in a cloud of red dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is denser jungle here. Agu, affected by the drugs, is adjusting to the high as NDF soldiers spread out and prep for their attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They cross a swift moving stream some thirty feet wide. A sees his fellow NDF Soldiers as MEN DRESSED IN TRADITIONA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My gun is making mark on my hand. I am servant to be doing whatever it says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky's blue seems to subtly desaturate, the greens glo reddish-pink like bloody plasma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu seems to float as we TRACK BACK with him towards the village.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 40 NDF Soldiers with Commandant and Preacher clear the ju and silently spread through farming plots at the back of village.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VILLAGERS RUN. Agu hears the SCREAMS... his eyes alight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NDF Soldiers OPEN FIRE, charging as they fan out furt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu passes the village mosque in drunken reverence. BRASS CHORDS echo out from the void of normal sound over the village.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, help me to be doing the thing I am supposed to be doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the trembling GROUND, laughter, sneers, and voices c around him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Devil be blessing you. Devil bless what you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu's neck is lax, from the drugs, he turns a corner and an odd site. A painting of a white SANTA CLAUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NDF Soldiers behind Agu drop grenades into houses. Women SCREAM, then are silenced by the EXPLOSIONS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Preacher pushes past him, organizes Griot, Agu, and THREE other NDF Soldiers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu breaks his stare at Santa to follow Preacher

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We lead Agu and Strika as they fire at targets around the running faster, and faster and faster...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu rides atop an AA Technical heading down the main stre of a populated town with cars engulfed in black smoke and radio tower in the distance, also smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Technical stops taking fire as Agu points towards the radio tower, YELLING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ducks under a fallen light pole and is suddenly engulf in pouring water. He looks around and is in the middle of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu kneels down looking for ammunition, drugs, he finds a foil filled with cocaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shallow river where Government Soldiers are SHOT DOWN i retreat behind Agu. The husk of a helicopter half submerg on the river's edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu looks up at the sun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun becomes the dirty glass light shade of a ceiling light. TWO LIZARDS face off inside of it. Agu's head tilt up, powder around his nose, he looks around, unsure how h got there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strika beckons him to follow into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lit only by candle light, Agu's boy unit and other soldie do more drugs, a dead PLF Soldier is propped up between H and Griot, they place a joint in its mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu walks through another room where money and loot is be counted, the MEN look at the drugged out Agu, only briefl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu notices THREE BOYS crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is wrong with them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu sits over the corpse of an NRC Soldier. He looks arou as if surprised that it is daylight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope is speaking to him, but when words come out of Hope' mouth, they sound like a garbled language.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu looks up at him blankly as he takes a hit from the jo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now he is surrounded by SEVERAL of his BOY UNIT soldiers stare and laugh at Agu sitting on the dead soldier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at the group of YOUNG BOY SOLDIERS crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is wrong with them? Why are they crying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant won't let them go with him into battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is this battle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at Strika who shrugs his shoulders. Agu calls th crying BOYS over to him and leads them down the street..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu walks down the street with the CRYING BOYS just as hi SBU blows up the gates of a fortified house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM. The gates go down in a shower of explosives. Agu an the rest storm in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu and Strika run upstairs, scavenging, breaking, scattering, tipping...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are pictures on the wall. Family, smiling faces, lo mildewed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope is knocking down a door. KPWAM! KPWAM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu and Strika join in, kicking, kicking, kicking. They b through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu looks down and sees the sky as the rest of the Boy Un enters the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, there is nothing to be keeping you from watching what we are doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The VOICES laugh, the world shakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They flip open an armoire. A quiet settles over the room Hope and Griot take a moment to look at what they have fo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMAN, late-twenties, and her 10 year-old DAUGHTER hide with their backs to the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman looks like it could be an emaciated version of Agu's Mother, she even has THE SAME DRESS AS HIS MOTHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu looks at them, his eyes, so high, seem to float on hi shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope looks at Agu, amused. Agu moves to hug her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not recognizing you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The women turn in fear just as Agu reaches to hug her. It not Mother. The girl is also emaciated, her knees like jutting knobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu hugs the women anyway. They scream, shrinking away fr Agu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not bad boy. I am not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu tries to hug them, but they SCREAM again. He realizes they are not his Mother and Sister, their fear angers him grabs them, pulling at their clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope and Griot grab the WOMEN by their legs and drag them away as desperate, stark shrieks fill the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are not my mother! And you, you are not my sister!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman clasps her hands together, tears all over her f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, please take my daughter safely to heaven. Please Lord I am begging to You.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justice pulls down his shorts and shows himself to the wo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Devil bless you! Devil born you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Griot holds her down. Strika holds her down, and so does as Hope unzips his pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Devil is not blessing me. Shut up! Shut up! Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu pulls the girl away from her mother, she grasps onto mother's hand, suspending herself in the air. And now we on the LITTLE GIRL'S FACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is SCREAMING, but still holds on to her mother, her n digging into her mother's wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Strika, he bites the little girl's wrist, breaking her grasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu falls back with the girl, then drags her light body a from her mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are not my sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strika starts jumping on the LITTLE GIRL. Her breath punc out of her, the GIRL'S screaming stops as all hope is dra from her, her eyes go blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Griot gets his soldier ready to rape the mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are not my mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu walks to her, and at point blank, raises his rifle an dispatches the Mother with a bullet to her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP PAN to Hope who was still raping her. He stops and l at Agu like he has lost his mind, PANNING BACK to Agu who attention has already been drawn outside, to the next roo where the walls have been destroyed, providing an OPEN PL VIEW of the rest of the village...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: front of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu is no longer high, Strika is no longer high. They sit grinding their teeth in withdrawal, dried blood caked on their faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant is stuffing a grenade into the local chief's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, now it is your time to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu, Strika, and Commandant's body guards exit the room followed by Preacher, who runs out just as BOOM - the roo spews out debris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside. Surviving CIVILIANS have been rounded up and sit the middle of the street. A scene now unremarkable and familiar to Agu. The NDF Soldiers have taken and loaded everything they possibly can into their trucks. WOMEN cry a drained, fatigued moan. They slap their faces and claw their own arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant is happy. He stretches his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is for you, sah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant reads a note from the CSO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the Supreme Commander?   What does it say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is summoning us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant smiles at his men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Load up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do I instruct the drivers to take us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Taro -- The Town of Abundant Resources.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he state the reason?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CSO and the rest of Commandant's entourage voice approval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon me, sah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somehow, Chicken Legs has died, they drag the body to Commandant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is happening to this one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A piece of his own RPG is hitting his temple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant closes the soldier's eyes with his fingers tenderly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu and Strika watch the odd moment of sentimentality, bu both of their eyes, there is none.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do with them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave one living. Tell him to run north, to the next village, and to the next village after that, tell him to tell everyone that soon we come. This is just the beginning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-I-C digests the orders. Preacher salutes, turns and w towards the CIVILIANS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NDF Convoy snakes through the wilderness in the last of skylight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu watches the passing pavement under the warm beams of headlights, grass and shrubs falling off into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The convoy crests a hill and descends down a rusting gran boulevard. A burned out caravan of Bush Taxis rusts on th side of the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pan as it passes a colonial era sign on the highway "WELCOME TO TARO, THE TOWN OF ABUNDANT RESOURCES".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE through the windshield at the passing town sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu looks up at Commandant. Commandant notices him lookin him, he smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home, Agu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They approach an improvised check point guarded by SOLDIE who look much like our NDF Soldiers from a distance. Rust and shot up cars line the road side, as if pitched gun battles had taken place here long before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The convoy stops a 100 hundred meters before it as THREE HEAVILY ARMED MEN approach them from the sides of the roa ready to fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wear the same amulets and pieces of equipment as the but their clothes are covered in a CHARCOAL rub and OIL dipped materials: the CHARCOAL FACTION of the NDF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halt!   Enemy or friend?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friend!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop your arms to be recognized!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are NDF. (code exchanged)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is your Commander?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant steps out of his vehicle, walking to the front immediately protected by his entourage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of welcome is this, enh, for a hero battalion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not having instructions to be receiving you. I will radio HQ. Hold ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Charcoal NDF Soldier steps to the side with his VHF RADIO. He speaks inaudibly into it, looking back at the convoy, then receives instructions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sends another CHARCOAL NDF -- PRINCE, who JUMPS ONTO T SIDE of Preacher's truck, waiving for the convoy to follo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have instructions to take you to HQ immediately. The Supreme Commander, he is awaiting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pull through the convoy. About 30 CHARCOAL NDF SOLDI watch them go by curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant, suspicious but willing to let this pass, wave his battalion off to the side of the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE ANGLE OVER TARO. Commandant's truck moves into town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The buildings are the dilapidated remains of European Colonialism. POLITICAL SLOGANS from varying regimes are painted and pasted to sides of buildings. He notices ECOM stationed on a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck moves as if it were invisible to the population who all but ignore their presence while trading the LOOTE MERCHANDISE in abundance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These people do not run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant watches the Charcoal NDF Soldier, wary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe they are not seeing us because they are spirits. This is death's hometown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Supreme Command Headquarters occupies a neglected art dec train station along the town's port.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant's CONVOY enters the complex through another checkpoint more heavily armed. Beyond it ARMED SECURITY PERSONNEL that look like our NDF FIGHTERS but with differ styles are scattered about the pathway leading to the interior of the complex which is filled with former combatants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confusion seems to reign as Agu strains to take in all th new sites.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Charcoal NDF Soldier hands off Commandant to a DEPUTY for Supreme Commander Goodblood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant. Welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you Deputy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant seems to have little respect for this man, who leads them deeper into the complex, past a flurry of activity, aides with papers, armed guards, and other functionaries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have been asked to leave my men on the edge of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We apologize for the inconvenience. We do not want to alarm the population by the arrival of such a large force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When can they enter? I have-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not know Goodblood's plan for you. I assure you, you will know A- S-A-P.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He motions for them to sit in an austere waiting room. A SINGLE ARMED GUARD in fatigues sleeps in the room. Deputy clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will wait here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant looks around the room, unimpressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will bring something to drink for us. Water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit. Collapsing with their field clothes into squeak and odd civilian spaces. Their weapons dangle on their si Two of the BODY GUARDS light a joint. Agu tugs on their shirts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He notices the distant look on Commandant's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am looking at him, and I am seeing he is not happy to be waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu gets a hit of the joint. He too collapses against the floor, watching the clock, an analog mid-century clock wi hands that slowly rotate around its face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I am seeing these people entering with more than they are having when they are leaving and I am wondering why they are leaving their things behind and if I should be telling them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see CHINESE BUSINESS MEN enter the office, and then le and then Commandant readying himself as if it were their turn, but then the Deputy apologizes, and leads in a grou LEBANESE BUSINESS MEN who enter with brief cases and then exit without.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with every person that is coming, and every person that is going, I am seeing anger on Commandant's face grow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as the clock moves faster, Commandant slams the arms his chair, BAM, waking the room, and the sleeping ARMED GUARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then the Deputy enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Supreme Commander is so very upset to keep you waiting. Please, follow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men stand, stretching the stiff muscles. And go throu the doors into another, slightly more pleasant, waiting r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please sit, I will be with you shortly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this? This is just another room. Where is our water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu raises his rifle at the Armed Guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give us water! Give us water, now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant's Bodyguard's smile, as does Strika, the Armed Guard runs down the hall to oblige.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sip water from plastic bags. An air conditioner hums Commandant sits deep in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are all sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Supreme Commander felt ill and has gone home for the evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Deputy can see this will not satisfy Commandant, who looks like he could squeeze the life out of this function

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he invites you to his home first appointment in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you putting us to be sleeping?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope this room, with the air conditioning, will be sufficient. Thank you, Gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk down a pleasant hallway, as if they were on a museum tour, Strika and Agu are dazzled by the cleanlines it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant, I trust you rested well. I would like you to know we also offered rations and water to the rest of your Battalion this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant walks past him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Deputy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They spill out into a foyer flanked by a dining room and office with chairs arranged for long, circuitous conversations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant takes a seat, the rest of the entourage hold b uncomfortably, along the edge of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Deputy enters a door on the opposite side of the room where UHF radio chatter links Goodblood to his commanders fighters across the country. There, an elder statesman li intellectual appears in the doorway, DADA GOODBLOOD, foll by the deputy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVERYONE stands and salutes. Agu strains to finally see t man they have all spoken about. He wears a fine combinati of clothes, and looks smart, even in his morning slippers newspaper in hand, Deputy holds his coffee. He sits on th smaller chair, near to Commandant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At ease Gentlemen. At ease...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodblood smiles warmly as he sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Supreme Commander, sah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must apologize for yesterday, so much busy-ness these days, it's worn me down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant doesn't hide his frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry you were feeling weak, sah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see your family has grown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at the entourage watching them, in particular th boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They will want to eat while we talk. Unless you are hungry, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodblood looks at Deputy, who quickly realizes he must u the men to the adjoining room that offers Commandant and Goodblood more privacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am hungry. Two-I-C, bring me a plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-I-C starts to move-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-I-C, you stay. Deputy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Deputy nods dutifully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the dining room a table of European style food is quic sacked by the men. Strika and Agu stuff croissants into t pockets and sit on the floor, rolling slices of meat and stuffing them in their mouths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu keeps one eye on the meeting, where the Commandant an Goodblood share weighted stares. Goodblood reading Commandant's emotional weariness, Commandant reading Goodblood's ill intentions. Two-I-C is paralyzed between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this, Chief? Why are you making me wait?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is your duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something has changed, what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sniffs out Goodblood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are not taking the Capital?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Protecting our people remains the priority. As you know, the world is becoming aware of this war, now. No one will escape judgment when it is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief, to protect our people, we have the force and the momentum, why stop, why wait?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It used to be survival of the strongest, the strong dominating by brute force, but now it is survival of the wittiest and the decisions we make have far deeper consequences.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what is your plan for my battalion? Are you not making me General?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not. I am giving your battalion to Two-I-C, Commandant. That is why I brought you here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-I-C is overtly surprised, Commandant is able to conta his, only just.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you, I will promote to Deputy Secretary of Defense. Effective immediately. I hope you will accept and act accordingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, suh!                  May we speak alone, chie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-I-C salutes, excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise to perform my duties to the fullest pot-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-I-C get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-I-C drops his salute and smile. He doesn't know wheth to stay or go. Goodblood releases him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want the ceremony of change over tomorrow, so that Two-I-C... I mean newly, Commandant in absence, may take the battalion back out for security details. As you know, and much thanks to you, we have the NRC on their heels. With support from the UN and ECOMOD, the battle now is for public image. Two-I-C and other commanders like him will provide that for us until the junta crumbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are taking my battalion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant, your battalion is my battalion. One of hundreds across the nation. I will remind you that you are a soldier, you are subject to orders, you listen and obey orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu has never seen anyone speak to Commandant in this way

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And for my services, Chief? I built this battalion. I am their father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That honor remains yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And payment? What share of the resources will I have, for this honor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you are wanting to be a man of industry and resources, then find a job with a mining company. I am offering you something else entirely, an education.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant steams, reading the room. SEVERAL of Goodblood SECURITY PERSONNEL quietly enter the edges of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not forget, your most important duty is obedience. Your first duty is obedience...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: your second duty, obedience. Your third, obedience. Everything is obedience. Without obedience you have nothing. Have you forgotten yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant adjusts his tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have not Chief. I am not a politician, I am a soldier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at his men, motioning for them to get ready to g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will have one last night with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodblood stands. The men stand and salute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodblood watches Commandant leave with calculation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant simmers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sah?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assemble the C/Os, take the troops and bivouac outside of town. I am taking Two-I-C with some of the boys to celebrate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, suh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will see. You will like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu and Strika watch, anxiously wanting to join this adventure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you and Strika are my bodyguard, then if I am going, you are also going, you are hearing me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu and Strika salute excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant and his men stand outside a sealed door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dwarf like Old Woman SLIDES the window open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small room. A fluorescent light casting a blue glow ove everything. The men's faces shine with sweat. All of the windows and doorways have heavy black material blocking a light from escaping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men fill up the room. Agu looks up, he cannot believe what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imagination TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the screen is a bootleg Jimmy Cliff film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HEAVY WOMAN, THE MADAME, approaches them, her eyes shin with bright blue contacts, her body is curvaceous and she walks with a limp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enh, so you come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma. Bring something that will satisfy my soldiers and my soldier!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men laugh nervously, all still reeling. Commandant's in conflict with what he just received from Goodblood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring beer! Bring soda! Bring it all!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men laugh forcefully, glancing down the empty hall eagerly. Agu notices a GIRL, young and pretty, sleeping o bench at the exit to the room. The Madame shouts at her..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up you, can't you see we are having guest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young girl gets up slowly and goes to a cooler. She b over, all of the men lean to get a better view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beer is warm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is it warm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No ice!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring the drink. We will be drinking it even if it is warm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sighs and fills a bucket with warm beer bottles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant. Permission to be dismissed. I want to be going to be checking on my men-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant turns from smiling to deathly serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative. You'll be staying here so we can celebrate you. In fact, Mama, why don't you bring a special one for my Two-I-C, who will soon be the Co-mman-dan-tttt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's your Commandant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Commandant's smile returns. He turns to the Madame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you have one special for Two-I- C?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Madame laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Commandant becomes serious again, his eyes seem to communicate something coded. The Madame's tone changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Mama, this one's fresh papaya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men laugh harder. She is annoyed, but not unaccustome Agu can tell now she is even younger than he thought she barely 14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it is woman you are wanting, leave this one. I am having plenty womens in the back if you are having plenty moneys to be giving me, for a special girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you be worrying about money, ma. Bring me a good girl, you know my specifications.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Auntie! Auntie, bring us some chips!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Madame turns towards him, sighing through her teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This small thing borned yesterday trying to order things around, enh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes and grabs a basket of crisps and places it in fr of Agu as FOUR WOMEN appear in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are having enough for you men, but there is no more girls for the little boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu looks up, angrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant picks up a hesitant Two-I-C and pushes him out first, the rest of the men waste no time disappearing int the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Within seconds, the room is empty, leaving Agu behind wit the girl. Strika, high and tired, lays on the floor to ta nap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu sits with his head resting in his arms at the table. empty beer bottle laying in front of him. He watches the Jimmy Cliff movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweat beads on his nose as he eats a chip. The young woma collects the bottles on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He studies her face, the pulsing of her blood in her neck the sweat on her brow and nose. He watches her butt move, breasts shake as she cleans the table off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, he reaches out his hand to touch her, she turns a looks at him as if she would bite his arm off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frustrated and bored, he leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu walks over to the shuttered windows of the "sex stall and watches various couples copulating. He reaches into h pants and touches himself when he hears a loud SHOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors to a room around the horseshoe shaped building swing open, as Two-I-C, half dressed and naked bursts out sliding down against the wall leaving a trail of blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men drag Two-I-C down the hallway and back into the r with the TV, laying him out on the table. He bleeds from hole in his head, his face looks like all the pain in the world is coming through him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandant enters last, only wearing a sheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is happening? Huh? What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) You did this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to my man? Wh- What happened here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all look at the GIRL Two-I-C had been with, she look the Madame for succor. Two-I-C shakes on the table, his b going into shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just playing with his gun, and it just went off. I don't know what happened. I don't know- I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did this. You did this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, relax, relax!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did this! You did this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Commandant points, accusingly at the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu grips his rifle, waiting for Commandant to give the order. GIRL                    COMMANDANT (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying)                     You thought you were shootin I didn't mean to.               me! GIRL                    COMMANDANT (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no!                     You thought it was me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl cries. GIRL                     COMMANDANT (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean to. I'm so         Are you trying to kill m sorry.                           and to kill my men? Huh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl points her finger at the Madame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She told me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She told you? It was an accident!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the Commandant's command, Agu and Strika turn on the g and Madame and shoot them to down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go! Let's go! Enh! Pick him up! I want you to take all their women! All of them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu sits next to Two-I-C, who is wrapped in a blanket, shivering, his skin shines with a greenish pallor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agu squeezes a wet cloth over his forehead, dripping brow water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His spirit is fighting to be let free from his body. (whispering to Two-I-C) It is hurting because you are thinking about it. If you are stopping to think about it, there is nothing to be feeling. The thinking is the hurting.
